sen.j: 庭石（にわいし・ていせき）とは庭園における石の日本独特の利用法である。
sen.e: The use of garden stones is a unique Japanese method in garden.
The use of garden stones is a unique aspect of Japanese gardens.
The use of garden stones is a unique aspect of Japanese gardens.

sen.j: 天然の岩石を庭の材料として用いるものとして選び出し、加工せず庭の要所に配置するものである。
sen.e: Garden stones are selected from genuine rocks as materials of a garden, and they are laid out in the key points of a garden.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Garden stones are selected from genuine rocks as materials of a garden, and they are laid out in the key positions of a garden.
Garden stones are selected from genuine rocks as materials of a garden, and they are laid out in the key positions of a garden.

sen.j: 複数組み合わせて設置する場合は石組という。
sen.e: It is called ishigumi (rock arrangement) if they are combined together for layout.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This is called ishigumi (rock arrangement) if they are combined together for layout.
This is called ishigumi (rock arrangement) if they are combined together for layout.

sen.j: 日本庭園では必ず使用される庭園技法の肝である。
sen.e: The use of garden stones is a very fundamental technique which is definitely used in a Japanese garden.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The use of garden stones is a very fundamental technique which is always used in a Japanese garden.
The use of garden stones is a very fundamental technique which is always used in a Japanese garden.

sen.j: 欧米では天然石を加工せずにそのままの姿で利用することは極めて稀である。
sen.e: In Europe and the United States, genuine stones are rarely used as it is without processing.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Europe and the United States, genuine stones are rarely used as is without processing.
In Europe and the United States, genuine stones are rarely used as is without processing.

sen.j: この庭石の材質･配置で庭園の表情が決まると言うほどである。
sen.e: In Japan, it is said that the quality and layout of garden stones determine the look of a garden.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Japan, it is said that the look of a garden is determineed by the quality and layout of garden stones.
In Japan, it is said that the look of a garden is determined by the quality and layout of garden stones.

sen.j: 実際に日本ではさまざまな技法が生まれた。
sen.e: In fact, various techniques have been created in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In fact, various techniques have been developed in Japan.
In fact, various techniques have been developed in Japan.

sen.j: 一般に趣がある石とは以下のようなことを言う。
sen.e: The prerequisites of an artistic stone are as follows.
The prerequisites of an artistic stone are as follows.
The prerequisites of an artistic stone are as follows.

sen.j: 野面（のずら）である。
sen.e: It is Natural.
sen.cmt: 野面→定訳不明ですが→natual と訳しています。
sen.e: It is Natural.
It is Natural.

sen.j: 自然において長い年月を経て風化した石の表面が見られる。
sen.e: The surface of a stone looked weathered in nature through many years.
The surface of a stone looks as if it has been weathered in nature over many years.
The surface of a stone looks as if it has been weathered in nature over many years.

sen.j: 石の表情に変化がある。
sen.e: The look of a stone has many looks.
The look of a stone has many aspects.
The look of a stone has many aspects.

sen.j: 全体として特長がある。
sen.e: It looked characteristic in whole.
It has a characteristic look as a whole.
It has a characteristic look as a whole.

sen.j: 整形で無い表面に節理･層理が見られる。
sen.e: It has joints and layers on its unshaped surface.
It has joints and layers on its unshaped surface.
It has joints and layers on its unshaped surface.

tit.e: Categories of garden stones in use
Categories of garden stones in use
Categories of garden stones in use

sen.j: 庭石
sen.e: Garden stones
Garden stones
Garden stones

sen.j: 1個（1石）で十分に鑑賞できる。
sen.e: Well Worthy of admiration as a piece.
Well Worthy of admiration as a piece.
Well Worthy of admiration as a piece.

sen.j: 庭の景観を作るポイントになる。
sen.e: It is able to make a point in the view of a garden.
It is able to make a point in the appearance of a garden.
It is able to make a point in the appearance of a garden.

sen.j: 組石（物）
sen.e: Kumiishi (combined stones)
sen.cmt: 組石→定訳不明ですが→Kumiishi (combined stones) と訳出しています。（物）は意図が不明なため省略しています。
sen.e: Kumiishi (combined stones)
Kumiishi (combined stones)

sen.j: 2石以上の大小の石で構成する。
sen.e: Kumiishi is usually composed of large and small stones more than two.
Kumiishi is usually composed of two or more stone of large and small sizes.
Kumiishi is usually composed of two or more stone of large and small sizes.

sen.j: 立石、伏石、平石、構石として使用する。
sen.e: It is used as tate ishi (a garden stone that is set in an upright position), fuse ishi (a flat-bottomed stone), hira ishi (a flat construction stones used to build the main sections of stone walls, excluding corners. Often used in castle walls), or kamae ishi.
sen.cmt: 伏石→データベースに登録がなかったため、暫定的にfuse ishi (a flat-bottomed stone) と訳しています。構石については検索しましたが不明です。
sen.e: kumiishi is used as tate ishi (garden stone that is set in an upright position), fuse ishi (flat-bottomed stone), hira ishi (flat construction stones used to build the main sections of stone walls, excluding corners, often used in castle walls), or kamae ishi.

kumiishi is used as tate ishi (garden stone that is set in an upright position), fuse ishi (flat-bottomed stone), hira ishi (flat construction stones used to build the main sections of stone walls, excluding corners, often used in castle walls), or kamae ishi.

sen.j: 同系同色の石を使うのが基本である。
sen.e: It is basic to use stones in similar colors.
It is basic to use stones of similar colors.
It is basic to use stones of similar colors.

sen.j: 飛石
sen.e: Tobi ishi (stepping stones)
Tobi ishi (stepping stones)
Tobi ishi (stepping stones)

sen.j: 園路に配置する石で踏面が平らになっているものを進行方向に配置する。
sen.e: Tobi ishi are stones with a flat top that are laid along a garden path toward the direction of forward movement.
Tobi ishi are stones with a flat top that are laid along a garden path toward the direction of forward movement.
Tobi ishi are stones with a flat top that are laid along a garden path toward the direction of forward movement.

sen.j: 小さ目の1足物から両足で立てる2足ものや多足物など大きさによって呼称が異なる。
sen.e: Naming of stones vary according to the size; the smallest size for one foot, the midddle size for both feet, the largest size for several legs.
Naming of stones varies according to size; the smallest size for one foot, the intermediate size for both feet, the largest size for several people.
Naming of stones varies according to size; the smallest size for one foot, the intermediate size for both feet, the largest size for several people.

sen.j: 打ち方も数種類あり2連打ちや3連打ち、雁打ちなどがある。
sen.e: There are several ways to align stones; niren uchi (zig-zag alignment), sanren uchi (L-alignment), Kari uchi.
sen.cmt: 雁打ち→定訳不明ですのでスペルアウトのみとしています。2連打ち、3連打ちに関しては下記のサイトを参照し訳出しました。http://www.handsman.co.jp/myweb/D72-1.html
sen.e: There are several ways to align stones; niren uchi (zig-zag alignment), sanren uchi (L-alignment), Kari uchi.
There are several ways to align stones; niren uchi (zig-zag alignment), sanren uchi (L-alignment), Kari uchi.

sen.j: 沓脱石（くつぬぎいし）
sen.e: kutsunugi ishi (a flat-topped stone used for taking off one's shoes before entering the entrance or a veranda (a narrow wooden passageway along the edge of a house facing the garden)
kutsunugi ishi (a flat-topped stone used for taking off one's shoes before entering the entrance or a veranda (a narrow wooden passageway along the edge of a house facing the garden))
kutsunugi ishi (a flat-topped stone used for taking off one's shoes before entering the entrance or a veranda (a narrow wooden passageway along the edge of a house facing the garden))

sen.j: 飛石と建物の出入り口を結ぶ石。
sen.e: It is a stone connecting tobiishi and the entrance of a building.
It is a stone connecting tobiishi and the entrance of a building.
It is a stone connecting tobiishi and the entrance of a building.

sen.j: 約90×40×30cm以上のものを使用するのが一般的。
sen.e: It is common to use a stone in the size bigger than 90 by 40cm and 30cm in height.
It is common to use a stone larger than 90 by 40cm and 30cm in height.
It is common to use a stone larger than 90 by 40cm and 30cm in height.

sen.j: 石積用
sen.e: For stacked stones
For stacked stones
For stacked stones

sen.j: 護岸や法面などの防水・土砂流出防止を目的に使用される。
sen.e: It is used for bank or slope to keep water or solid from outflowing.
It is used for bank or slope to prevent outflow of water or solid.
It is used for bank or slope to prevent outflow of water or sand.

sen.j: 山石
sen.e: Yama ishi (stones from mountains)
Yama ishi (stones from mountains)
Yama ishi (stones from mountains)

sen.j: ゴツゴツした角のある石で山などの地表面に露出しているものや地中に埋まっているものを掘り起こして使用する。
sen.e: It is a rough cornered stone which is used after digging from the ground; some may be seen over the ground, while others are buried deep in the ground.
It is a rough cornered stone which is used after digging from the ground; some may be seen over the ground, while others are buried deep in the ground.
It is a rough cornered stone which is used after digging from the ground; some may be seen over the ground, while others are buried deep in the ground.

sen.j: 山さびがつきやすく植物の根が入り込んでいるものもある。
sen.e: Mountain-specific rusts often adhere to Yama ishi, and some Yama ishi are with roots of plants covered.
Mountain-specific rusts often adhere to Yama ishi, and some Yama ishi are covered with roots of plants.
Mountain-specific rusts often adhere to Yama ishi, and some Yama ishi partly contain the roots of plants.
sen.cmt: 「入り込む」の部分を変えました。

sen.j: 埋まっているものは天然石のように見せるために、加工して風化が見られるように凹凸や傷を施す。
sen.e: A Yama ishi that was buried in the ground is processed so that it would look like a genuine stone adding some irregularities and flows.
A Yama ishi that was buried in the ground is processed so that it would look like a genuine stone, adding some irregularities and flaws.
A Yama ishi that was buried in the ground is processed so that it would look like a genuine stone, adding some irregularities and flaws.

sen.j: 川石
sen.e: Kawa ishi (stones from a river)
Kawa ishi (stones from a river)
Kawa ishi (stones from a river)

sen.j: 丸みが出て趣のある庭石で最も庭にふさわしいとされる。
sen.e: It is a round artistic stone that is considered to be the most suitable stone in the garden.
It is a round artistic stone that is considered to be the most suitable stone in the garden.
It is a round artistic stone that is considered to be the most suitable stone in the garden.

sen.j: 1971年に制定された河川法により河川からの砂利等の採取が禁止された。
sen.e: The River act established in 1971 prohibited picking of resources such as gravels from a river.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The River act established in 1971 prohibited picking of resources such as gravel from a river.
The River act established in 1971 prohibited picking of resources such as gravel from a river.

sen.j: 現在国内では特別な許可が無ければ採取できない（昭和46年採取禁止）。
sen.e: Nowadays, none of extractions is domestically approved unless a special permission is obtained (it was prohibited in 1971).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Nowadays, no extraction is domestically approved unless special permission is obtained (it was prohibited in 1971).
Nowadays, no extraction is domestically approved unless special permission is obtained (it was prohibited in 1971).

sen.j: 現在では石材業や庭石業を営む会社等は、山の土地を取得して加工をしているところが多い。
sen.e: Today, organizations including a stone material company or a garden stone company tend to obtain the land for processing stones.
Today, organizations such as stone material company or garden stone companies tend to obtain the land for processing stones.
Today, organizations such as stone material company or garden stone companies tend to obtain the land for processing stones.

sen.j: 海石
sen.e: Umi ishi (stones from Sea)
Umi ishi (stones from the Sea)
Umi ishi (stones from the Sea)

sen.j: 波の力によって表面の変化に富む石。
sen.e: It is a stone with various looks caused by wave effects.
It is a stone with various looks caused by wave effects.
It is a stone with various looks caused by wave effects.

sen.j: よく貝が付着している。
sen.e: Shells often adhere to it.
Shells often adhere to it.
Shells often adhere to it.
